POOLS.DESCRIPTION: Explore the benefits and features of our precious metal investment pools.
POOLS.HOW_POOLS_WORK_DESC:
Members' funds are used to buy units in pools they select. These pools are primarily invested in precious metals (95% or more), including Krugerrands (1 Oz, 1/10 Oz Gold, and 1 Oz Silver). These assets are globally recognized and highly liquid. Note: Gold Krugerrands do not incur VAT. The pools function solely as a co‑operative allocation system to:
- Enable bulk purchases for members
- Apportion safekeeping, insurance, and administration costs fairly on a pro‑rata basis
- Calculate each member’s patronage proportion
POOLS.VALUATION_FLEXIBILITY_DESC: Pools are valued daily. Members may buy or redeem units at the current unit price and can customize deposit allocation across available pools.
POOLS.OWNERSHIP_CONTROL_DESC: While the Co-op manages the pools, members own them via units. Units can be redeemed for cash or metals, and members can transfer units to other members or switch between pools with appropriate notice.
POOLS.MEMBERSHIP_REQUIREMENT_DESC: Only members of Bullion Beperk Co-operative Limited can invest. Personal data and holdings are confidential. Members access personalized data and unit values via secure login.
POOLS.MEMBER_OPTIONS_DESC: Members may withdraw units for cash and/or metals with notice. Physical collection is available in Pretoria or Johannesburg, or delivery via secure courier.

FAQ.TITLE: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.Q1: What makes Bullion's pricing and structure unique?

A1.INTRO: Gold and Silver pools (i.e. the unit prices) are valued at the daily wholesale price (which is priced around a 5% premium over the London PM Fix). A member buys in and sells at this price. The admin fee and commission are added when buying in.
POINTS: Buying elsewhere may cost 10% or more over the London PM Fix. Selling may yield less.
The unitized system ensures members rarely sell for less than wholesale (London PM Fix +5%).
Trade cost is reduced to ~0.15%, significantly lower than competitors.
Bullion offers full transparency and low pricing for members.
Traditional unit trusts cannot hold physical precious metals due to FAIS restrictions. Bullion fills that gap.
A1.REDEMPTION: Redemption: Members can redeem units for cash, gold, silver, platinum — or any combination.

FAQ.Q2: How safe are my holdings with Bullion?

A2.INTRO: Please refer to Policies and Procedures document No 2-2025,

REQUIREMENTS: Minimum lump sum tranches of R5000 (initial or additional amounts).
Minimum debit order of R500 per month.
There is no maximum investment limit.

FAQ.Q4: Why unitized pools instead of direct holdings in precious metals?

BENEFITS: Reduces entry/exit costs from over 5% to as low as ~0.15% per trade.
Accommodates round amounts without precise metal pricing (e.g. R100,000).
Allows smaller investments (e.g. R500 debit order) that still gain exposure to metals.
Enables flexible cash withdrawals (e.g. redeem R4,500 from R545,678.98 value).
Insurance, admin, and safekeeping costs are paid by the pool, not the member.
Enables seamless switching between pools at wholesale pricing (~0.25% cost).
Avoids typical commissions and price reductions associated with metal sales.
A4.NOTE: Note: Unitizing avoids cross-subsidizing — each deposit/withdrawal occurs at the unit price of the day.

A5.INTRO: Unitizing is a method used to accurately record each investor's share in a pool of assets. It ensures pro-rata cost distribution.
A5.NOTE: Each member's share is now calculated accordingly based on units held and unit price.

FAQ.Q6: What will affect a member's composition of coins or bars in the pool?

POINTS: Monthly cost deductions: Costs for insurance, vaults, and administration are deducted monthly or as they occur. This slightly reduces metal holdings unless topped up.
Cash reserve effect: Holding a portion in cash buffers metal price fluctuations but may affect unit price sensitivity.

FAQ.Q7: Is it important for a member to keep his composition of coins and bars at the same level?
FAQ.A7: Not really. Members primarily seek capital growth. If the unit price increases, value increases even if the coin/bar mix changes.

A8.INCOME: Income Tax: None. No interest = no income tax.
A8.CGT: Capital Gains Tax (CGT): Applies only when units are sold for cash or metals are sold thereafter.
A8.VAT: VAT: Not applicable to Krugerrands. Applies to silver.

FAQ.Q9: What happens if Bullion sells or delivers silver?
FAQ.A9: VAT OUTPUT tax must be paid to SARS. Members may reclaim it if VAT registered.
